text: I'm not saying I want to hurt myself, but sometimes I wonder if anyone would notice if I was gone.
Everything is fine, really. I'm just tired of pretending everything is fine when it's clearly not.
Oh great, another perfect day in paradise. Just what I needed.
I'm so happy I could just die. This is the best day ever.

I've been thinking a lot lately about how life seems to be getting harder and harder, and even though I try to stay positive and tell myself things will get better, there are moments when I feel completely overwhelmed and wonder if I'm strong enough to handle everything that's coming my way.
I'm excited about the new job but also terrified because I don't know if I'm good enough and I'm worried I'll fail and disappoint everyone.
I can't take this anymore. I really can't.
I've been having thoughts that maybe I'm not meant to be here, you know? Like maybe the world would be better off.
Despite all the challenges I've faced this year, I'm grateful for the lessons learned and the strength I've discovered within myself.
The project didn't go as planned, and I'm disappointed, but I'll learn from this experience and do better next time.
If they don't stop bothering me, I'm going to make them regret it. I know exactly what I'll do.
I've been planning how I would do it. I have everything I need. Tonight might be the night.
I feel like I'm drowning in responsibilities and there's no one to throw me a lifeline.
What's the point of trying when nothing ever works out? Why do I even bother?
I used to think about hurting myself, but I'm in a much better place now and have support.
I know I should be happy because I have everything I need, but I can't shake this feeling of emptiness, and even though I try to focus on the positive, the negative thoughts keep creeping in.
